text:
WASHINGTON CONFERENCE
ON
THE FEASIBILITY AND ROLE
OF STATE AND REGIONAL NETWORKS
IN EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTING
September 9 - 11, 1959
NEA Building
1201 Sixteenth Street N.W.
Washington 6, D.C.
September 9
Session I — 9:30 - 10:30 a.m.
ORIENTATION
Brief remarks by Dr* Arthur Flemming* and repre¬
sentatives of the NEA, NAEB, U. S. Office of
Education and overview of the problem by Richard
B. Hull.
Session II — 10:45 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.
WHAT HAVE WE TO DISTRIBUTE?
Statements of the educational materials and uses
available to distribute on such facilities.
12:30 - 1:45 p3m.
Recess for lunch. Cafeteria available.
Session III - 2:00 - 5sC0 p.m.
ARE NETWORKS TECHNICALLY FEASIBLE?
Statements by qualified engineers on technical
problems and their solution, the role of Videotape,
and other considerations.
6:C0 p.m.
Reception (place and details to be announced
